Description: Painted sycomore fig wood shabti with a black curled lappet-wig, a brown face with black detail, a red, blue, yellow and black collar, projecting crossed arms, the body is painted white, the long triangular apron of the kilt is inscribed with a central column of Hieroglyphs on a yellow ground bordered with red lines.
Acquisition notes: Paper label inscribed 'C. 82. 31', previously attached with string, removed and stored with object, 15/6/2017 (JHT).
